remarks: Lagrange theorem for Groups: the order of any subgroup of a finite group is a divisor of the order of the group.  This is Metamath 100 proof #71.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jul-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
statement:
lagsubg.1 $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
lagsubg $p |- ( ( Y e. ( SubGrp ` G ) /\ X e. Fin ) -> ( # ` Y ) || ( # ` X ) ) $.
